Key Arguments: The proposed legislation infringes on the fundamental right to free speech.
The legislation sets up a government-controlled 'Ministry of Truth' that coerces social media companies into censoring users.
The government and mainstream media are unjustly exempt from the legislation's scope and penalties.
Existing laws, such as those under the ACCC and defamation laws, already address issues of misinformation and disinformation.
The legislation is unnecessary and represents government overreach and contempt for the electorate.
Notable Quotes: The right to free speech is the most fundamental right we have as Australians.
By this legislation, the government is setting up an Orwellian 'Ministry of Truth'.
The legislation is an egregious attack on individual free speech and cannot be allowed or tolerated in a democracy.
It is better that ten people are misinformed than that one is deceived through censorship.
